channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NH

item.title: Report E-2025020092
item.description:
Report E-2025020092

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. RS personnel dismantled the impacted pallet as well. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum.
